title: Looking for a type
content: Hi. I would like to know if someone knows types that have been design in homege to a city. I
author: alex_f_h

comments.content: [Twin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075644/http:/design.umn.edu/go/project/TCDC03.1.TTC), for the the Twin Cities. It changes with the weather. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Guy Jeffrey Nelson's FF Providence is named after Providence, Rhode Island!   
   
 [http://www.fontfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075644/http:/www.fontfont.com/)

There is also Linotype's Wiesbaden Swing;   
   
 [http://www.linotype.com/1605/wiesbadenswing-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075644/http:/www.linotype.com/1605/wiesbadenswing-family.html)   
   
And of course, Apple's (?) Chicago.   
   
That about covers typefaces named after cities I've lived in. I don't think that anyone has ever released a "Baltimore" face ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)
I am looking for a font that looks like a rope, does anyone know of such a font?

[rope](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075644/http:/www.myfonts.com/Search?searchtext=rope) or [a little less literal](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075644/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/F/GIDD/F_GIDD-10005000.jhtml)   
   
Arlene, it is always best to start a new thread instead of   
confusing the conversation with an off topic question. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
